alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 02 at 2:26PM PST until January 05 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM MONDAY TO 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches in the high elevations with under an inch in the valleys. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Humboldt County. * WHEN...From 10 AM Monday to 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions alongside reduced visibility with blowing snow. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of strong winds along side new and preexisting snowfall will be the biggest concern for the period. Expect widespread blowing and drifting snow to create hazardous condtions especially for those traveling in the overnight and early morning hours.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
